Nursing is embedded in the history of Canada. For this cause, the nursing profession is highly valued in Canada. So, if you’ve chosen to study nursing in Canada, you’ve made a brilliant choice.

What is the best Nursing Program in Canada?

Nurse Avenue provides an overview of some of the best undergraduate nursing schools and nursing programs in Canada below.

University of;

What is the hardest nursing school to get into?

In terms of what degree is awarded and how selective it is the University of Columbia is known to be the top one nursing school in the state of New York and also ranked number one in the country. It is also the hardest school to get into attracting thousands of applicants every year.

Nursing Education in Canada

Official education is compulsory to become a nurse in Canada and every part of the world. You need to get hold of a two-three years diploma in nursing to start your nursing profession. However, a four-year baccalaureate degree is the ideal maximum necessity for nurses. While holding a diploma or degree in nursing or degree in nursing does not qualify you to practice nursing profession in Canada. It is only the condition for you to meet the criteria for writing the licensing examination.

List of the Best Nursing Schools in Canada

You are now exposed of how to proceed with your nursing education in Canada, what are the schools to begin your nursing education? In this section, we will give you a list of the best thirteen (13) nursing schools in Canada.

Note it’s only the best schools that are selected based on their global ranking number of nursing programs they offer.

Below are the lists of the best schools based on their criteria.

  1. University of Toronto
  2. University of Alberta
  3. McMaster University
  4. University of British Columbia
  5. McGill University
  6. University of Ottawa
  7. Queen’s University at Kingston
  8. Université de Montréal
  9. University of Calgary
  10. The University of Western Ontario
  11. Dalhousie University
  12. University of Manitoba
  13. Université Laval

University of Toronto| Nursing Schools and Universities in Canada

Address: 155 College St Suite 130, Toronto, ON M5T 1P8, Canada.

Tuition: $9,100.00 (Domestic Students), $51,660.00 (International Students).

The university is a very old known university in Ontario Canada. It started operating in 1827 and offers degree programs in a wide range of discipline to over 60,000 students. his prominent university has twisted three Governor-General of Canada, four Prime Ministers of Canada, and fourteen Justices of the Supreme court. This Canadian public university does not produce people in government, however. It also produces the best nurses in Canada. Its Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing is one of the best schools of nursing in Ontario and Canada in general. QS World University ranking ranked this Canada school of nursing 2nd in the world for nursing schools. The Toronto’s University nursing programs includes a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BScN),   Master Programs, Post-Master Nurse Practitioner Diploma (PMNP), Master & Doctoral (Collaborative), and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.).

University of Alberta| Nursing Schools and Universities in Canada

Address: Edmonton, Alberta T6G 1C9. Canada.

Tuition: $6,207.60 (Domestic Students), $25,978.40 (International Students)

Similar to UToronto, The University of Alberta or UAlberta is a different well-liked school in Canada. It began its operating as a public university in Edmonton, Alberta in 1908. The university has therefore lived for 111 years. UAlberta has also created notable alumni like Governor General Roland Michener and Prime Minister Joe Clark. Offering over 400 programs through 18 faculties, UAlberta is a global research university.

The University of Alberta’s Faculty of Nursing is the second best school of Nursing on our list. It ranked 17th in QS World Ranking for Global Nursing School. UAlberta’s Faculty of Nursing offers a diversity of undergraduate and graduate nursing programs. Its undergraduate programs comprise BScN Collaborative, BScN Bilingual, BScN Honours, After Degree Program, and Registered Psychiatric Nurse to BScN. On the other hand, UAlberta’s nursing graduate programs are the MN (Master of Nursing), Ph.D. (Doctoral Program), and the Online Ph.D. Cohort

McMaster University

Address: Hamilton, Ontario L8S 4K1, Canada.

Tuition: $6,042.60(Domestic Students), $35,634 (International Students)

McMaster University is a public university in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. It is also one of the oldest universities in Canada. The university started operating in 1887 and has been it began operating in 1887 and has been donating renowned programs in a wide diversity of discipline to its students. The university has over 30,000 students and has also produced alumni who have taken government positions also business leaders. McMaster school of nursing in its 2024 world University ranking. In addition, the 2024 Times Higher Education ranking placed the University as the 72nd internationally respected university. You can offer Basic (A) Stream BScN degree if you haven’t had a nursing education before. You can as well take the Accelerated (F) Stream, or the Post RPN (E) BScN undergraduate degrees. Meanwhile, for graduate study, you can study either the MSc thesis Based, MSc Course-Based, MSc Course-Based PHCNP, PHCNP Graduate Diploma, or the Ph.D. degree programs

University of British Columbia| Nursing Schools and Universities in Canada

Address: T201-2211 Wesbrook Mall. Vancouver, BC Canada V6T 2B5, Canada.

Tuition: $179.97/per credit (Domestic Students), $1,270.79/per credit (International Students).

The University of British Columbia (UBC) this is one of the public university in Canada with the best nursing school. UBC is the British Columbia’s oldest university and it has formed a great alumnus including Canada’s first female Prime Minister, Kim Campbell. In addition it offers the great accredited degree programs to over 63,000 students from Canada and other parts of the world. The UBC nursing school has lived for over 100 years and it has been offering the best Ugraduate and graduate nursing program constantly to its student. UBC’s school of nursing offers a BSN program for undergraduates; MSN, P.hD., MN-NP, and MHLP for gradate, and Summer programs. The reason of these programs is to produce nurses who will make a difference in the world.

McGill University| Nursing Schools and Universities in Canada

Address: 680 Sherbrooke West, Suite 1800, Montreal, QC, Canada.

Tuition: $7,940.10 (Domestic Students), $ $20,229 (International Students).

The McGill University is another top university in Canada. It started operating as a public university in Montreal in 182 and currently it offers degrees and diploma programs in over 300 academic disciplines. It has five astronauts, the present minister of Canada, and the present Governor-General of Canada. Its Ingram school of training started in 1920 and has been providing a world-class nursing education ever since. To support its mission of training future nurses and optimize the quality of health, the Ingram School of Nursing gives a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BScN) and a Bachelor of Nursing (Integrated) BNI for undergraduate students. Master’s students, on the other hand, can apply for the MSc (A) Direct Entry, MSC (A) Nurse Bachelor Entry, MSc (A) Nurse Practitioner, and Global Health Studies. Also, Ingram School of Nursing offers a Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Nursing as well as postdoctoral studies.

University of Ottawa| Nursing Schools and Universities in Canada

Address: 451 Smyth Rd, Ottawa, ON K1H 8M5, Canada.

Tuition: $499/per credit hour

The University of Ottawa (uOttawa) is another university in Canada with the best school of nursing. It began operation as a public university in Ottawa, Canada in 1848 and now has a student population of over 41,000 students. UOttawa is a comprehensive university that offers a large number of degree programs in various fields of study in both English and French. In fact, it is the largest bilingual university in the world, and it boasts of a graduate employment rate of 97%

Queen’s University at Kingston

Address: 92 Barrie Street Kingston, Ontario K7L 3N6, Canada.

Tuition: $7,333.58 (Domestic Students), $48,077.78 (International Students)

Queen’s University at Kingston is another university in Canada with one of the best school of nursing. Queen’s is an old public university in Canada. It began its operation in 1841 and presently offers accredited programs to over 28,000 students. Also, Queen’s University at Kingston maintains a rich history. It was the first university west of the Maritime Provinces to admit women. Today, it has produced alumni who are government officials, academics, and business leaders.

University of Calgary

Address: 2500 University Drive NW Calgary, AB, Canada.

Tuition: $3,231.54 (Domestic Students), $11,003.04 (International Students).

Université de Montréal

Address: CP 6128, Succursale Centre-ville, Montréal, QC  H3C 3J7, Canada.

Tuition: $1,195 per session (Domestic Students), $8,186 per session (International Students)

The University of Western Ontario

Address: London, Ontario, Canada, N6A 3K7.

Tuition: $6,050.00 (Domestic Students), $39,836.00 (International Students)

Dalhousie University

Address: P.O. Box 15000, Halifax, Maya Scotia, Canada, B3H 4R2.

Tuition: $10,857.06 (Domestic Students), $21,071.06 (International Students)

University of Manitoba

Address: 89, Curry Place, University of Manitoba, and Winnipeg, MB R3T 2N2, Canada.

Tuition: $5,700 (Domestic Students), $19,100 (International Students)

Université Laval

Address: 89, Curry Place, University of Manitoba, Winnipeg, MB R3T 2N2, Canada.

Tuition: $8,852.28 (Domestic Students), $20,370.78 (International Students)
